reviewText:
Early Access Review

Im over 100 hours now so thought it might be time to write a review - i have only been playing multiplayer with mates so cant really comment on the single player experience.

This game is a lot of fun to play.  Kinda like minecraft, you gather resources, build stuff and avoid the natives.

The natives themselves have one of the more interesting AI's of any game ive played.  sometimes they leave you alone, other times they are like a swarm of bees trying to take a piece of you.  The intensity of the attacks / number of natives varies dependant on where you camp and how much you aggrevate them.

Cave exploration is well done and the number and complexity of the caves is increasing with each patch.

Building and crafting is easy to perform and makes sense.

PROS
Native AI (they really are interesting to sit back and watch)
Looks great
Crafting
Cave exploration
Dynamite (woo hoo - no more chopping trees)

CONS
a bit glitchy at times (but has not really been enough to scare me off - Hey it is an alpha)
There can be some differences in gameplay between the HOST and the CLIENTS
♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s with dynamite
Houseboats (less said about that disaster the better)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Forest is definetly one of my favourite games despite it only being 0.12 Alpha as I'm currently writing this review. The gameplay feels fluid and not clunky to me. The video settings I feel are ample for the game and I can only imagine the options getting more in depth. I feel like there is a huge amount of potential within this game and I can see it being a big contender when finally finished and polished up.

Moving more into the game itself, you will see a lot of bugs because it'a an alpha although there are a few which will require you to reload the save but fortunately I haven't had that happen enough to me that I have complained. The A.I in the game suprise me each time I load back into singleplayer or even multiplayer, although the atmosphere completely changes on multiplayer as the isolation factor of being stuck in a forest/island alone with no idea of what could be hiding in the tree trunks above you or following you at a respectable distance. After the initial settling in" you might find yourself running out of things after establishing a defendable base and eco-system within it. Saying that there is a nice cave system with a definetly fear element (Atleast to me
date: personally) once you go deep down into them
recommended: regardless if on multiplayer or singleplayer
hoursPlayed: you will find yourself letting out a noise or two or possibly some bodily fluids. After doing the exploration of The Forest/Island you sort of run out of things to do really.\n\nWrapping up my review

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is the perfect early access game. It's everything I ever wanted from a survival/horror game and I recommend that anyone who plays Minecraft will like this and also anyone who likes survival to begin with. This has to be one of the most impressive games from an indie developer I have ever seen in a really long time and I thank them for that. For an indie title, this game looks so good that it kind looks like a triple-A title. Not only does it look so great but the crafting system is amazing too. I cannot give a numerical rating yet because of it's early access state in which it stands right now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is excellent, the visuals are genuinely fantastic and not as hardware demanding as you might think. The developers keep the updates contstantly rolling out with the date of the next update shown clearly on the main menu.

Definetly one of the better survival games on steam, albeit also one of the scarier ones too. The bad guys are truly terrifying at first when they turn up to way you up as your scouring the wreckage of a plane crash and you have no idea of where you are or where to go.

The online co-op mode is a fun mode too with everybody somehow agreeing to build a fortress together of everybodys design.
Somebody once knocked down my newly built tree house down by cutting down the tree! Grrr!

I highly rate this game and its still in alpha phase. I can't want until the next update, or the next, or the next...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There's not many games today that offer a real challenge. Even fewer that make you genuinely afraid of the enemy to the point that hearing their call ring through the air puts you on instant alert and sends you straight into fight or flight mode. The Forest does all this and more.
The preset build options are excellent and can quickly allow you to build up a safe place to store weapons and supplies but the custom build options take that to a whole new level. At my current progress in my most recent save I've built a platform at the opening to the plane fueselage with a log cabin, fire pit and I am currently in the process of putting walls around it, once done I intend to build ramps up and around a tree so I can place a tree house near the top for a good vantage point.
The challenge in the game is to be able to do all that while avoiding enemies, catching or finding food to eat and locating or creating safe water sources to drink. The game has an excellent feature where by typing 'veganmode' at the games main screen you can turn off the enemies, build a base, go back to the main menu and type 'meatmode' to turn the enemies back on, reloading your savegame and you can use your newly built base as a starting point to go exploring but beware, the more days you stay alive, the more difficult and aggressive the enemy become.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Forest is an amazing experience
Pros:
-Great crafting system
-Fun base building mechanics
-Tons of fun with friends
-Beautiful world and graphics
-Enjoyable fighting
-Cheap, making it worth the price tag
Cons:
-Bugs (although few they still get annoying)
-Lack of content (in early access so i expect a lot more in the future)
-Too much work for single player, requires multiplayer to survive most nights

Overall I would recommend to pick this game up with your friends

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Anybody who's seen the movie Cannibal Holocaust will absolutely love this game. As I was playing it and building a massive log fortress, making bombs and molotov cocktails and cutting down trees with dynamite I started to compare this game and that film, and I also started to question my motives as well.

In the film, yes, they did find an actual cannibal tribe but the cannibals weren't ♥♥♥♥♥♥ or anything, I mean they ate people and stuff but that's kind of just a part of their culture, they didn't go and try to kill the film crew to eat them or anything. The only reason the cannibals killed them in the end was because the film crew was terrorizing them in order to make them look like the monsters we wanted to see them as.

In this game, you find a tribe of cannibal mutants that at first seem a little curious when they first see you, but as soon as nightfall arrives they find you and they try to kill you and eat you. But are they REALLY monsters? After all, they aren't actually human, so technically it isn't really cannibalism. As I played I realized that in this situation neither of us were monsters... I mean the ones that are like spiders are monsters but whatever.

Then I realized that they were just acting like every other normal human being would given the current circumstances (besides the cannibalism). They came over to check me out and when they started beating the crap out of my cabin, something that they'd never even seen before and to them might be some kind of blight on their homeland, I killed a couple of them with an ax and lit another one on fire with a molotov cocktail. Of course they're going to send more and more guys after me in an attempt to kill me, I'm just slaughtering the poor ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s left and right singlehandedly. As far as they know I'm some kind of demon.

But then again I'm not really doing anything wrong either. All I'm trying to do is survive, and I don't think that cannibalism is good, so when they try to play me like that I have to cut one of their heads off and put a bomb in it.

Okay, maybe I went a little too far with that. I think I might actually be the monster.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game, lot of people still think to use the plane axe as a weapon. I advise against that.
Skull + stick = club
club + tree sap + tooth = Club +1 Damage
club +tree sap + feather = Club +1 Speed
club + tree sap+ booze = Club + glow in the dark aspect
club + cloth = Club + fire aspect (I don't use this one though)

I think you get the idea (: Upgrades are important in this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My plane went down and it appears as if I'm the only survivor... I had a child. Forget his name already. He may still be alive. Some naked guy took him. Not my problem. I've rummaged through all of the luggage and managed to find this pen and paper. I guess I'll keep a journal.

Day 1 - Some more crazy naked people scared the living jesus out of me, I started to build a shelter in a nice little spot, but had to abandon it. I heard terrifying sounds and bolted. Did not look back. I ran until I couldn't run anymore. I've come to a beach with a few cargo containers kicking around. Looks like a good spot. Tonnes of stuff to loot, including what looks like an old campsite... but the tents are still up. Nobody else is around. Half built my crappy little shelter, got a fire going and put some delicious lizard on it to cook up. Going to go grab some logs before the sun comes up.

Day 2 - I was out of camp a little longer than expected... I had my two logs up on my shoulder and was nearing my camp when something caught my eye, some shadows moving IN my campsite. I dropped my logs and got out my axe, and started running towards it. The two shadows left as quickly as they had come. Those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s took my cooked lizard. (Or I left it on the fire too long) either way. I was not a happy camper. I finally managed to build my hunting shelter though. I see a log cabin in the book... going for that next because why not.

Day 3 - I was out cutting down trees when I heard a terrible sound behind me. Two naked guys were there staring at me. Judging me. Hating me. I ran. Screw the logs. I did find a sweet skull on the ground while running though. Grabbed it. Got back and made a skull club. They didn't follow me. That day. Tonight they came up on my camp again. I SWEAR it is the same two stalking me this whole time. I've named them. One is ♥♥♥♥, the other is Jimmy. Jimmy got too close... I didn't mean to I swear... but I had to bash his skull in. Jimmy ran off...

Day 4 - Dear god. There is definitely more than two this time... Six? Maybe seven.... They're all out there around my camp. Running around all crazy like.... It's time to make a stand.

(The journal seems to stop there)

11/10   Such a fun game! And in early access? Definitely worth the 20ish$

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've not played this game for long, and this is taking into account that the game is in it's early stages but holy moly. It's so much fun, especially with friends. The game is extremely immersive to the point where when you actually get back to your home after exploring, it feels like getting back home after a day out. It builds a huge amount of tension when exploring caves or dark areas and geniune fear when you hear the screams of the enemies. It's been a long time since a game has made me excited to come home and play and The Forest currently fills that role. This being early access this is a sign of a top quality finished product (when it is finished) and a sure sign that the developers are fully invested in creating the best game they can make. You'll never know how much you like The Forest until you actually play it and it is well worth the current asking price (£10.99 in it's current state). The multiplayer although needing some tweaks (plenty of time, early access afterall) is the most fun I've had on a game in years and the in-game voice feature of using a walkie-talkie to communicate with your friends all over the map is a great idea. Don't review games often, this probably makes no sense but damn, The Forest is good and is only going to get better.

Things you should know about the Cannibals:

1. Some of these Cannibals can climb trees. (i learnt this the hard way).
2. Cannibals will investigate....
3. Cannibals work as a team and will assist each other.
4. They can have either torches or flashlights, yes flashlights.
5. They are fast, strong and hey can jump long distances (well some of them).
6. Avoid them as best as possible.
7. If one sees you, attempt to kill it straight away.
8. If there are three or more, RUN!!
9. They are in groups of four or more.
10. They like night walks.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPretty graphics. The sounds are very intense too and, at times, very realistic.  To the point where my cats are looking around the room for things that are not actually there. It has great juxtaposition between the pretty daytime scenery and the scary, half-naked cannibals that hunt you down in the pitch-black darkness.  Obviously there are numerous bugs until it's finished since it's still in Alpha, but I love the overall feel of this game.  A true survival game in my opinion.

Unlike many other early access games, this has great detail already in there and a frame rate that is good.

However like many other early access games, this is full of glitches. My favourite examples are the exploding body glitch where if you try cut up a dead cannibal body you get flung in the air like you're being rocket propelled and die, the ground disappearing act where you fall through the ground and end up somehow swimming under the ground with the trees sprouting up around you, and the roundhouse kick where the canniballs kick you and you whiz over the entire map and into the sea on the other side of the island.

Now you may be thinking, well hang on you're saying bad things about it when you're meant to be reccomending it?
This is true, and so I just want you to know that despite the problems, it is a great game which keeps you on edge constantly and really incorporates you into the game.

Overall I do recommend this game as it is very detailed and has surprises at every corner keeping you enthralled. And personally I find some of the glitches quite amusing. If however you dont want any glitches, then I highly recommend you wait for all the updates (which do help a lot) to take place, and then it will in my opinion be a perfect game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly i love this game. I bought it maybe 1-2 months ago and played it maybe 30 mins, maybe even more and i went to refund it but i had been declined because i owned the game too long. After being declined i decided to give it a go and started playing for real and started building things. Just today i have played this game for 5 hours, it is so addictive and fun. There was one bug that was a huge inconvenience and made me finally take a break. I built a custom wall but everytime i went to go chop more logs, id come back to find one or two sections missing from my wall. Other than that, it has been the best game ive played in a while and i have already recommended it to my friends and my brother with constant pestering for him to get it. 10/10 would play again

Also i think there needs to be more explanation on the traps because i went to set one but didnt understand how it works, so now i have a useless trap sitting right next to my house. Doesnt worry much it just makes my place look 'ugly' so to speak or more messy in a way.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok so to start, this game is constantly updating and is always looking for ways to improve. The creators of the game really care about the community too. I've posted loads of feedback/errors and most of the time, someone whos created the game or just the fan base responds quickly. If no one responds they go ahead and release a hotfix to fix the issue. The game is in alpha but who cares, buy it now and watch The Forest rise to its undoubted potential. seriously though xD

The game requires a decent pc to run, but all this will be fixed with optimization over time, so nothing to worry about there. I have a GTX 770 and an i5 3570 and have no problem running the game 60 FPS while recording. Think of this game as GTA 5 ( the open world aspect ) meets minecraft ( the survival aspect ) having a baby naming it johnny but then legally changing it to The Forest and constantly feeding it more and more updates to make it better. And there you have The Forest. I don't recommend this game, i honestly think everyone should own it. Like i said GTA meets minecraft. But in all seriousness its minecraft on steroids and some other drug taken from sweet savory squid intestines and pork tenderloin. Ok so with all that aside, you're all going to buy this game and if you dont like it, well to be honest... i dont know whats wrong with you <3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Day 1:
I realise my plane has crashed, my son is gone, but ♥♥♥♥ him. It's time for an adventure.

Later: I start building shelter, for the cannibals, so they can't find me.

Day 2:
Had a good night, only one cannibal patrol, so I'm good. Made a better axe, using a stick and a rock. It's faster slightly.

Later: Killed a couple of attacking Cannibals in self defence.

Day 3/4/5/6:
I made a better base on the beach, with a head thingy to scare away some cannibals. It's kind of working. I hope

Later: Saw multiple patrols. One ran towards me and I wiped them out. BIGGER SCARING AWAY THINGY.

Day 7/8:
I'm heading for a cannibal camp. I remember seeing it in the woods. I'm making a small shelter for the night.

Later: No one in sight.

Day 9:

I attacked a camp, killing almost everyone, took some stuff, then got attacked and knocked out by a female cannibal on a tree. I find my self in a cave. WAIT. DON'T KILL ME!!

---Extract Ends Here---

For the real review, that was my gameplay experiance, it was FUN, trust me. The game is suspenseful and requires you to use the most of your equipment and strategies to survive the says and nights, from dying of either natural or being eaten by a crazed foreign cannibal.

The graphics are beautiful, especially for an indie game.

I haven't got much more to say really.

Pros
+ Beautiful Graphics
+ Suspenseful Gameplay
+ Fun combat
+ Easy to use Backpack
+ Doesn't leave anything unused.

Cons
- Can be buggy, but I won't let this affect the score since it's EA
- A bit of a clunky AI.
- Could be more easier to use Crafting system, and it should be able to show you recipes.

Overall:
This game mixes Survival and Action into a hasteful battle between life and death. As you scour from the beaches to the forest, you are never safe. Be careful, out there, since I think this game is a MUST-BUY

9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First off, I have to admit something very important: this game scares the absolute ♥♥♥♥ out of me. This has been the first game in a long time that actually made me scare quit in sheer panic, and I will provide some scenarios later.

If you like survival + needs management, crafting/building, horror, exploration, and death, then give this game a try - I think you will really enjoy it; or even really enjoy hating it for scaring/killing you so much, but also making you come back for more.

As an early access game, this has easily been one of the most impressive alphas I have ever played. The aesthetics are fantastic, and, if you can run it, you will be in for a very nice treat the first time you gaze out on the ocean from within a forest of dense trees and foliage. The music and sounds are very subtle, and a very faint scary-movie-like-noise will warn you when enemies are nearby (crazy story later on).

The controls are easy to familiarize yourself with - there are many button prompts as seen in the Dead Island games (ex: key bind e" hovering over lootable items). At times
recommended: the controls may not be as responsive
hoursPlayed: and you may often find yourself repeatedly trying to pick up items on the ground (the key is to make sure you can see the button prompt; try walking around it and panning the mouse around until you get it). The learning curve is moderate to difficult if you aren't used to open-world survival games - you really have to balance securing your shelter/food and watching out for the enemy. You WILL die many times during your initial playthroughs - do not be alarmed
voteText: just take a deep breath and learn from each experience.\n\nAs the sole survivor of a brutal airplane crash on an island inhabited by cannibals
helpfulPercent: your first task will be to immediately loot the inside of the airplane and the immediate surroundings (you can use your axe to break open luggages). Be quick
votesHelpful: as the crash site is randomized and so are enemy patrols - you could have several minutes to just one or two. A good thing to do is to loot the inside
votesTotal: run to the nearest collection of bushes
votesFunny: and hide. Wait until you see the cannibals (they will most likely come to investigate). When they leave
commentsCount: loot the outside
column16: then find a place to establish your base.\n\nYou have to manage your needs
column17: primarily hunger and energy. To do this
column18: you can eat some of the candy bars you looted from the airplane wreck to satisfy your hunger. You can drink some cans of sodapop to regain energy
column19: or go to sleep. Note that sleeping in any form of shelter is currently the only way to save.\n\nThe inventory management is really cool - you can see all your items laid out on a blanket when you go to your inventory. From here
column20: information on each item is given
column21: and you have the option of crafting items. One such item (very useful against enemy mobs
column22: especially in the beginning when you are weak) is a molotov cocktail
column23: made by combining one bottle of alcohol with one piece of cloth. Another thing I really like about this game is the fluidity of gameplay - when you are looking at your inventory or have pressed ESC
column24: the game is actually still progressing - so you could close your inventory only to see group of cannibals ruunning toward you.\n\nCombat can get very difficult
column25: but the latest patch allowing you to block with the fire axe (starting weapon) has made this element less of a suicide. I have been one-hit killed a number of times
column26: thrown forcefully into a tree
column27: and I am unsure whether this is part of the game or a glitch.\n\nThe AI is amazing! The personalities and tendencies of each cannibal can vary - some will cry over the death of their allies
column28: others will bow before you
column29: and many will pull and drag a downed ally away from you. Females seem to be the most aggressive
column30: however
column31: almost all cannibals will become extra aggressive during the night. Enemies will do different things when they encounter you - some will just watch you curiously
column32: others will wait for reinforcements
column33: and others might even run away.\n\nThe developers are very active
column34: with times given right in the menu of how long before the next build is released. There is a peaceful game mode
column35:
with no cannibals to worry about - this can be useful for helping you get your bearings on the game mechanics.

Story time!

So there I was
column36: using my axe to open the luggages littered a good distance from the airplane crash. I had scouted and waited for enemy patrols
column37: but saw no one. Since I was trying to open the luggages as quickly as possible
column38: I had been looking down the entire time. I heard the faintest noise
column39: but thought nothing of it. A few minutes later
column41: so I look up (see nothing) and turn around. No sudden music
column42:
just a group of 3 cannibals staring at me curiously.

I shouted "OH ♥♥♥♥!" in the psychology lab of my school. I rarely shout during horror games.

Rage quit story!

It was the dead of night.

I had been a short distance from my camp chopping down some wood to build my cabin
column43: when I noticed a group of 4 cannibals (one holding a torch) walking toward my camp. I immediately backpedal further into the forest to hide
column44: almost running to a separate duo
column45: one of which had a flashlight fixed to a pole attached to his back (like a lantern banner). I panic and backpedal some more before they spot me
column46: but the lantern-man's ally sees me and rushes to engage.\n\nWe trade attacks and I am seeing red. I risk a glance to my left and spot the lantern-man rushing toward me. The fighting had caught the attention of the foursome at my camp
column47:
and I see them begin walking toward me.

It is at this point where my assailant decided to climb up the closest tree.

I nope'd right out of there.

If you are a survival
column51: then get this game and give it a try.\n\nRecommend
column52: and be prepared to die and get scared!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

7/10

This review takes into account that the game is still in alpha, and subsequently it is pretty buggy including some bugs which may deter people to begin with, for example after saving the game and then leaving the game, and then re-launching i am no longer able to load the game (a copy of the save is non existent), and a few rendering bugs but nothing to get worried about, the only real problem ive had with the game itself so far was the game being more of a choir than an actual enjoyable experience, the enemies are unrealistically hard to kill, you can die from falling a meter or two and the animations are a tad buggy. But this can be forgiven, the graphics are pretty sweet, and the game runs fairly smoothly, considering the forest is only in alpha, the prospects of the game are very promising, i have no doubt that these improvements/tweaks will be made in the forseeable future and the game will develop into an enjoyable and fun experience.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To start of I'd like to say It's got a recommendation because of the potential this game has.
With that I would Like to add that if you are short on cash and looking for a game to play,
I would pick up another game. Why? Simply because The Forest is In it's Alpha state, and with that
has a ton of bugs and flaws. It's barely playable in this state. so I would suggest you to buy it in a later state.

As for the game itself, not including the bugs,

The Forest is a game with lots of potential, and I'm sure the developers will build towards the expectations.
The Graphics are great, especially for an indie game. The enemies excist of cannibals, Mutants and wildlife.
Crafting in The Forest has been kept simple, and for that I hope there will be improvements, more crafting options and more crafting materials, wich on that part I'm sure will come.
What I love about the game is that there are patrols roaming around the island, giving you the feeling your never safe, and always watched. this mechanic is really well done. The cannibals also climb in trees, so you have to be constantly on your toes if you want to survive in this horror survival.



The story:

The Game starts you off in a plane with your son. unfortunately the plane crashes and you and your son are one of the few survivors of the crash. when you come to your sences you see a man walking up to your son, taking him with him. leaving you falling back to black out again. when you wake up later, wounded and dehydrated in the plane wreck, you start off with some handy supplies such as your backpack, Lighter and a axe found in a stewardesses body. you find out that you have little time to look around the plane wreck and you'll have to start gathering resources and build a shelter to save and rest in, and a fire to stay warm at and cook food.

Tips and Tricks:

Always be careful picking a location for your shelter since the cannibals patrol the island.
If you 'Die' in the game the first time you will be taken to one of the cannibals caves, with them probably assuming you were dead. but beware, if you Die a second time you will really be dead, and you WILL have to start all over again.
You are a really buff man, and you can carry 2 logs at a time!
There are suitcases lying around the plane wreck and some boat wrecks. they can be opened by hitting them with your axe.
Press 'I' to open your inventory, and press 'B' to open up your survival guide.
Do NOT let the cannibals flank you. if you encounter a group of cannibals, I would advise you to run and hide. if fighting is inevitable, keep an eye out for all the enemies. they WILL charge at you from behind. If they find your camp and they are attacking you, try to mak them run in the campfire, this way they will be weak enough to take out.
BEWARE: some cannibal corpses are known to explode when you hit them.

This was my review of The Forest.

I would rate it a solid 8/10 when the bugs are fixed, and if they add more features to the game I will reconsider this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Loving this game so far, can't wait to see more from this developer. Here's my lets play and full impressions of the game. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ozETWRAYPI

The Forest offers a visually immersive survival experience, with the addition of co-op it would become a staple for survival horrors. The AI are incredibly intelligent and frightening at the same time. There is great attention to detail within the game instead of just a large landscape without any character. Majestic mountains and secret oasis's can be found around the island. There are so many things to find in this game that it makes it worth getting simply for the exploration.

This is the first game that I have found in open alpha that hasn't disappointed me, with the exception of contagion. The game is obviously not finished, but it is poised to become an absolutely great game if the little bugs can be fixed. The game is ENTIRELY playable at this point however, I highly recommend purchasing it before the price goes up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ALPHA REVIEW:

The Forest is a game that even in the alpha state it is in at this moment has fantastic graphics, good developers, and fans that love it.

First time playing: Ran into cannibal village to greet my neighbors; they had me for a BBQ dinner.

Second time playing: Got caught and shoved into a cave, rumors has it i would still wander them now 4 days later.

Third time playing: I found a bunny :3

Fourth time playing: Found my bunny again :3, had to kill it for dinner ;_;.

Fifth time playing: Attempting to sell log cabins to my new neighbors; they caused a riot and ate me.

Sixth time (current): Exploring


I look forward to updates this game will get in the future, and if multiplayer gets added in the future I will definitely play this a  lot with my friends.

DISCLAIMER: No cannibals were hurt in the making of this review, 1 bunny died sadly, he will not be forgotten.

10/10 would recommend, and 10/10 would definitely play more of it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Forest is a mix of the heart attacks brought to you by Amnesia mixed with the building system similar to that of Rust.

Pros: Great Building, Great atmosphere, stable early access (singleplayer)
Cons: Multiplayer preformance issues, Multiplayer sync issues, Bloom and Brightness effects are locked in place and make the game...well lets say you are staring into heaven for a few minutes at a time during midday.

12/31/14 Game state: Fun singleplayer, do not purchase for multiplayer yet. One of the scariest survival games on the market, really recommend for the singleplayer experience. Multiplayer will be great, but simply not playable at the moment.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The  Forest is the best sandbox survivor I've ever played. I wish I had gotten my hands on it sooner.

The combat is fluid and responsive. From my experience in most other survivor genre games, the combat animations and mechanics are clunky, lackluster and usually down-right laughable. The Forest pays special attention to polish, making sure that immersion is never sacrificed. Animations and impacts are all very tangible and rewarding.

The audio is great too. Lots of variety in this department, and there's a casual increase in the amount of sinister sound effects that you hear throughout The Forest as the nights carry on and you expand your marooned empire.

The enemies are tough and will hunt you down until they knock you unconcious and drag you down to the caves below the surface, effectively into the mouth of hell. You must then fight your way back out in the pitch black armed with only your melee weapon and a lighter.

It's worth every dollar of the fifteen asked for it during early access.

Bought it yesterday and have already spent 12+ hours on it.. i've gotten lost in The Forest

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wanted to recommend the game and write a review a couple of days after I bought the game, but decided I wasn't putting enough time into it to see where it was going, how often the devs would work on the game, and watch the game play out.

After this last update, I played a few hours last night and was completely impressed. The Devs are definitely making progress with the game pretty quickly I'd say, compared to a few others I and my friends have invested in.

In short and not really breaking the game down like everyone else, I recommend the game fully; Cannibals, Head Pikes, Your fellow passengers being turnt into contorted tennis ball dispensers, building tree houses, looting the Cannibals territories along with their makeshift camps, cave exploration (though honestly I haven't done that much cause well, being underground in a cave bearly lit by either a flashlight, torch, flare, or my handy lighter along with an unknown amount of cannibalistic mutants after my lucky charms, I tend to keep high ground.), Nature, Hunting and Fishing, Molotovs. I really shouldn't have to say more, Buy this game, Support the Devs, and Enjoy, I have a feeling there is only more to come.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Forest… It just has a menacing undertone to it. It seems anything you apply the noun of the location it seems to give it a type of pristineness, whether admerason or melevilance. The Forest lands on the latter.
The game experience is rather well put together in its current state (pre alpha). But where to start..
The graphics are are ok, to me the shadows will be the focus when in the woods trying to gather resources. The shadows are done well so far, the shadows move with the sun, diminish in the morning and thicken at sun set. I am sure these shadows will be your worst enemy out there in the future updates since this is where those crazy man eaters are hiding, so keep an eye out.Some of the graphics will seem dated in its current form but they do not take away from the horror/suspense.
The sound effects are quality so far, some need improvement. Right now there is a warning song played when an enemy sees you and changes when they enter attack mode. I wish they made more noise when walking and make sounds themselves. I think the music is a good way to know something is watching you but I would prefer to be able to hear them walking, breathing or talking in order to spot these guys but not yet (this kind of takes away the immersion effect). The rest of the sound effects work for the game, from chopping trees down, swimming, walking and jumping, The atmosphere also benefit from the sound design from rainfall to bird songs all give a good level of immersion to the game.
The Animations and models are basic right now. Swing hatchet at randomly chosen native trying to kill you (one of only 4 I see) , repeat. Now there are stronger enemies but they too also only share a few different models. With that said these models (or lack of) do not take away from the game play at all, the models are terrifying in any situation. The firee light and animations are also done well and the light from the fire does get blocked from an object and creates their own shadows. But don't get too close to your fire pit/fire pole or you will be burned. But these also burn the enemies and wildlife too. So place some fires around camp and they help fend off those bad guys.
Overall the game is quite fun so far, tho a bit repetitive on building and crafting (as of now) there are only a few diff buildings you can make and walls to help protect you more will come I am sure, but after a few hours of play you will have built all buildings/traps that you have. So the main question is do you wait for the actual release or is it good enough to play and buy now?? I say buy it!! You will not disapointed in this survival horror game. With updates coming out almost once a month the content coming will keep you interested in the game. Each new start also creates a new starting location or new map (not sure on this part) but each start is a new place so far. Buy it be safe and get to chopping trees!! Its your only hope to survive; BUILD!
~n00bz~  rating scale:
Graphics (pre alpha) 6/10
Sound/music: 7/10
Gameplay: 9/10
Replay value: 8/10
Glitchiness (not factored in overall): 5/10 (just weird stuff happens at random times)
Creep Factor: 7/10
Overall pre-alpha:  7.4
Passover or Buy: Buy
voteText: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Even though this game has many bugs, it is still a very playable and enjoyable game. I'm really excited for the new patch that is coming out, I cannot wait to see what fixes they do and what they add.

Here are a few things to know about the game before you purchase it:
-This game is in Alpha, which means that it is not even remotely close to being finished.
-There are many bugs, especially in co-op mode. It is still playable, especially if you're patient enough.
-You can only have ONE save right now. If you start a new game and save and you had a game going previously, you will lose your other save.
-There are terrain bugs that will make it hard to do certain things (ie trees that are growing out of large rocks can be impossible to chop down)
-The sunlight is obnoxiously bright at times and will make it a lot harder to see anything because it darkens anything around it if you're facing it (I'm hoping they fix this eventually because it can be a real pain)
-This game is totally worth buying. It has nothing but potential to be an amazing game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game graphics are absolutely beautiful, there's no doubt about that! Probably one of the most visually pleasing titles I have seen in a long while. The game conecpt is rather exciting as well, pushing aside your normal zombie/supernatural survival type experiences. Also, one must keep in mind, there are no 12yo KOSer's running around becuase its a single player experience... for now. When they do plan on implementing multiplayer, it will be co-op based. I can also rest assured that the multiplayer will be localaly hosted, so you can pick who you want to play with.

Overall, even with the bugs that are present, this is an exciting title. One I have been waiting for, for quite a long while. As the devs continue to push out content and updates and get past the alpha stage, I won't be surprised if this title is entered as a Game of the Year". 10/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Watched my kid get carried away by a pedophile- Check
-Found a weapon- Check
-Built a shelter- Check
-Almost ♥♥♥♥ myself trying to run away from a herd of naked men- Check
-Fall off cliff trying to run away- Check
-Wake up in a cave with what i thought was first sausage but turned out to be bodies- Check
-Escape cave while almost having a heart attack because no matter how many lights you turn on in the house, your still panicing not to be ♥♥♥♥♥- Check
This game is by far the best survival / horror i have played yet. It well incorporates the survival part with things such as hunger, energy and well death. As for horror.... I will be honest i am squimish when it comes to horror games but this by far made me scream at the top of my lungs when i was being chased by a pale nude man. The graphics are amazing and i have had no problem with starting the game as i have seen some people. The bugs though.... are how I shall say.... suprising for the least. Example: I am walking on the beach and i go to hit a turtle, i am then launched across the map into a tree in which I fall to my death. Also to add to the bugs is the cooking will not work whatsoever, falling through rocks (It is rare), some buildings wont place, cannibals freeze etc. ANYWAYS to sum this game up it is definitely a game to try for everyone even if you are squimish (there is gore). The gameplay and graphics highly outweigh the bugs and flaws as they will be fixed in 12 days from now with some new content being added. I cant wait till they add some new things to try and hopefully to convince you to buy this amazing game!
9/10 For the idea and working gameplay alone.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

THE BEST HORROR SURVIVAL GAME I HAVE EVER PLAYED!!! 10/10

I will break my review down into pros and cons.. starting with cons which is nothing

Cons:

Why is this game in Alpha? It literally seems perfect to me as far as optimization and content,

Pros:

Music- not much music, but the menu theme and when cannibals are close really sets the mood
Graphics- very nice graphics, simple yet appealing, 60+ frames all the time. i'm running a GTX 770 with VSync enabled. Without Vysnc I literally run 200+ FPS, but I prefer my GPU to be stable and not overwork itself which is why I leave VSync on.
Gameplay- Outstanding, The crafting system is perfect compared to other survival games. This game doesnt require a billion materials to make anything. you can make anything you want at your fingertips pretty much. Also suprisingly to me the story is good.. just a plane crash on a deserted island with cannibal/skinwalkers on it. The cannibals can be a pain in the ♥♥♥ at times and they can be very ♥♥♥♥ing scary.. like holy ♥♥♥♥... I've played Outlast and other horror games.. but the cannibals in this game can be very terrifying (mainly in their numbers and how they appear so randomly).

**NOTE TO NEW PLAYERS**
When you first start playing this game.. get away from the plane crash ASAP. The faster you get away from the plane and toward the beach the better, So far I have started a new game 5 times to test some things and i found that the beach is the best spot and the quicker you get away from the plane crash, the more time you have to build your base up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is aboslutely stunning, the surroundings around you are so beautiful.

Nearly everything in the map of the game is interactive, such as realistic cutting simulations, etc; cutting a tree down will require you to move around the tree, and have you swing your axe at it at a mostly realistic times for the tree to be able to be successfully cut.

The game also gives you a feature to not die insantly, instead, get kidnapped to the cannibals cave, we're you can find more items, and weaponary, giving you a better chance of surviving on the island.

There are bugs, but that's not a suprise, as this is a public alpha, there are some bugs, such as the constructed tents not able to save the game, the game may sometimes crash, and interacting with other things throughout the map. In the future, this will likely to become fixed, but as for now, it's a really good game that can be enjoyed for the older groups.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Since its release to alpha it was made aparent this game and the people behind it are somthing rare and special.

The forest is a sp/coop survival game placed in a remote enviornment. A survivor of a plane crash you must come to your senses, no guns no gimiks just you a crafted axe and a forest filled with canabals er mutants as they like to be called. A lil more realistic than rust this is no 7 days to die game. The lighting and gfx are moving in an exciting direction. As is the dev of the game.

Endnight games has blown the bar right off the hangers here. Consistant updates (literally, i mean these guys put the counter on thier game menu) and meet the timeline without fail or immeadiate communication. The steam community is being managed in a manor that should become codex for ea games. The game itsself is a awesome example of care and skill. A great base with wip that not only is fun to use but allows for player input. The work being done here is beyond my highest expectations of this nature and after a long time of consistant performance this games quality and ability cannot be contested by even the big names out there..... in fact all big names out there are hard pressed to keep up with the level of skill being displayed here.

Anyways. as I usally do i warn : if you dont know how to deal with beta games please wait. If your a gamer like me i recomend this one and actually ask you to come help us with this one. It has great potensional and the devs really desurve the help and effort.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe Forest is gorgeous for being in alpha stage. It is one of the things that initially attracted me to this game besides a promising storyline for single player. Lately, the community is demanding a lot with co-op gameplay so it seems like each time the devs release an update the majority of it is dealing with co-op. I'm not complaining, I like playing with others but I would also like to see some major things being done with single player and building and crafting. Right now there is a limited amount of things to do as far as crafting and building and exploring and once you've done everything there's nothing really left to do but get creative and build a bigger, more elaborate base. I hope to see them open the map, add more things to craft and build, basically add more things to do, objectives, storyline, creepier caves, more monsters, etc. I'm really looking forward to the finished product. I've never gotten excited about a game like I am about this one.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nDo you like chopping down trees and collecting leaves from bushes? Do you like carrying up to five rocks at any given time? Do you often wish you could chop a monitor lizard with an axe and wear its shimmering hide? Do you want to be surrounded by groups of native mutant tribesman that stare at you threateningly before rushing you with makeshift weapons and ultimately drag your unconscious body away? Do you wish you could wake up in a dark cave surrounded by the corpses of fellow non-natives with only a Bic lighter to light your way out of an intricate system of tunnels with deadly drops hidden in the dark? Do you like mutant tribesman climbing trees to spy on you after you've escaped their cave, all while you grill rabbit in a rainstorm near a hastily made leaf leanto? Do you often dream of taking revenge on previously mentioned mutant-tribesman-kidnap-voyeurs and ripping them limb from limb with your monitor lizard axe before posting their severed heads, arms, and legs on pikes to decorate your campsite in a show of glorious bloodlust victory? If you answered yes to these questions, you should play the Forest, because you can do all of those things. You can also stab fish with spears: the way a real man goes fishing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best games I have ever played. Constantly being upgraded and evolving. Beautiful graphics. Overall this game is on another level from all other survival games. The greatest thing about this game is it's use of the dark. When it's dark it is really dark. You can't see your hand infront of your face. This is usually followed by a scream in the distance as they come for you.

I cannot over-sell it. This game is truly beautiful and terrifying.

I found that the game started to stagnate for a short while, but then I realized it was because I was too afraid to explore. This game can be so terrifying you don't want to leave you base. You just want to stay alive. You won't. Once you get better you will for some solid stretches of time, but eventually they find you. Save often.

Once you get over your fear of venturing out into the world, and grow a pair enough to start going down into the caves the game really comes to life...and the real terror begins. This game is amazing.

Sadly my game has somehow glitched this time not allowing me to pick up the rebreather. I can find it and pick it up, but it will not enter my inventory. I have survived nearly 80 days and built multipe large encampments. This rebreather issue limits where I can go so I will likely have to start over.

Here is the thing...this game is so good I don't really mind.

As you learn in the game and explore your working knowledge improves so much your survival skills increase. You build smarter. You farm resources more efficiently. You become a better killer.

No mutants will stop me. I will rule this island.

This game is worth every penny.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can't recommend this game enough. If you're a fan of survival games such as Unturned and Minecraft, the chances are you'll really enjoy this game. I've so far only managed to set up a small campfire, a rabbit trap and a place to sleep and save my game. Wandering off generally leads to me being assaulted by mutants and dragged off to a cave. The Forest also features frequent updates which have a countdown in the main menu of the game, which seems to be a minimum of an update every 2 weeks. There's also talk of adding co-op to the game which I'm extremely excited for.

While I think the game is great, I really can't recommend buying it unless you've got a great gaming PC as it's not very optimized at this stage in development.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Almost two hours in the game and I absolutely love it. You start off on a crashed jet plane filled with sodas, rags and food. As you proceed towards the exit of the plane you pick up a hatchet that was stabbed in a flight attendent's chest. While you are outside there's luggages that are locked but you can break them open with your hatchet and there's also rabbits and lizards which can be used as a food source later on. But make your decisions quick and get the hell out of there because the mutants will ambush you and scare the hell out of you and kidnap you (what they did to me). Assuming that you got out of the area alive, you have to find a place you find fit for shelter (I prefer the coast because you can see your surroundings better). Your survival book is a HUGE help, look through it in order to build fires to cook your food and keep you warm. But be careful cause they're watching!

Only cons are the bugs, the bugs are noticeable as soon as you start playing. I'm not going into specifics cause there are too many bugs to name one by one. But then again it is a Pre-Alpha Build so you can't quite judge it yet.

Overall, this game is an amazing survival/horror game. It's definitely worth the price. I see lots of potential and I expect this game to be huge once it's finished. Completely recommend to anyone who loves a good survival game!
voteText: 8 of 11 people (73%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An alpha game that is already worth the money it costs, with excellent features, devs that regularly update the game (one update every 15 to 25 days) and who listen to the players and teh community.
The bugs at this version 0.14 are not too many or too gamebreaking, and quite tolerable, plus they usually get fixed in one or two updates time, while a larger gamebreaking bug IF one occurs (rarely) gets fixed with a hotfix in 2-3 days.
The gameplay is awesome, with the only thing thats puts you off (just a little bit) is the many trees you have to chop down, but only if you are the creative huge base - building player. The enemies are pretty smart, give you a natural feeling with the way they act (travelling at packs, checking out noises they hear, women freak out if a patrol/family member dies etc.)
Caves provide extra horror, with stronger mutant enemies that can kill in one blow, while offering prety good loot to gather (cassetes, booze even a flare gun), making the player to go cautiously tempted by the loot inside but fearing for his life on the other hand.
The structures and the building are pretty diverse, with new things added almost every update, the crafting is also very nice.

Overall a very enjoyable game, very much worth the money it costs, definitely worth getting.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Innocently went about my business...built a fire, a hunting shelter, ate a few mushrooms. Brief encounters with natives that ended in simple staring contests left me feeling empowered. Started work on a cabin, all was well. But then..... disaster. Hostile natives came at me from all directions, even the trees. As I fended them off with my trusty axe I could feel the strain of combat taking its toll on my body, but I had gone this far and there were only two natives left. I could do this. I could claim this land as my own. They had taken my child and kidnapped me to show me their horrific ways. No more. I would eradicate this evil from my home. I turned to swing my axe. I was met by a club to the arm, I had miscalculated their speed! I staggered back, my armor gone. The native came in for another attack, this time to my chest. I braced for impact. His club hit me with unimaginable power. I felt my chest cave in and my skin burn as I was catapulted at supersonic speeds above the forest in which I had crashed. And then, just as the plane that had brought me here had, I crash landed on the other side of the map.

10/10 would be catapulted again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Three goes I gave this game, and each and every time I was at least entertained.

On my first attempt, I was struck by ungodly lag. After witnessing a child being taken away, I awoke to find myself on a plane. I chowed down on everything I could find on the plane and set out to find a tree to conquer.
Twas then that I stumbled upon a tribe of happy locals, ready and willing to show about the island on a wonderful and exciting running tour, which ended in my falling over a cliff edge.
It was in that time that I noticed just how nice the graphics are.
The locals must have noted my fall, as they took me to an underground dwelling where they had tied up all of the other passengers on the plane, probably to keep them from getting sick from the water on the cave floor.
Soon after I died, as it was too dark to see where I was going. The light I thought was the exit was a friendly local who beat me back to safety.
I lasted 2 days.

Attempt number 2 went a little better. I found an axe and set out to take down a tree again, but the lords of clipping failed me and I fell over another cliff. See attempt one for details.

Attempt number 3;
I was wise to the locals by this point. After devouring the plane, taking the axe and heading towards the best looking water I could find, I landed upon a beach. There was a dead local who I put to rest by blowing him apart, a tent with a stick I used to stab things, and plenty of beer.
I found a tree to conquer, but the locals must have come back for their friend, as they were waiting for me. I immediately hit legs, hoping they had not noticed me. I was not being chased so I imagined I was fine.
I found a boat and thought it would be a great place to hide, as these friendly locals did not seem to have a swimming school set up anywhere.
Night fell and all was peaceful, but I was definitely wrong about the swimming lessons. The locals swam out to assist me off the boat, but I refused and ran as fast as possible after exiting the boat.
It began raining as I reached safety, and I was told that I needed to start a fire. I had all of the things I needed but leaves, so I promptly froze to death in a small, premade hut that I think belonged to a local.

All in all, hard but fun. I enjoyed the tense feeling right the way through and look forward to future editions of the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is incredibly fun! As soon as you get out off the plane you are to gather as much supplies as you possibly can before the cannibals go and investigate, You can simply get all you need to survive for a day or two before you actually go and hunt right from the start. Building your shelter and such though will take some time, and building it at the wrong place can cause your life.

The forest looks amazing, will take you some time to get familiar with it with all the cannibals out there (And because is Huge!). Amazing thing is that the forest ain't even done, there are more areas to be made in the near future! it lacks a bit in the resources however, finding animals to hunt is a little difficult, but a update will be made later on where more animals to hunt will be added. Also there are some things that you can't build, and now that the infinite flare gun is out, there is no more advantages lol. My tip for you guys will be to make as much Molotovs as you can by combining Bottles and Rags. However this game is still in Alpha, and there are only 4 people on the process of making it. I give them props, 4 people and they are able to make and amazing game, You guys won't be dissapointed!
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To me, there has never been anything as intense or rewarding as THE FOREST. It redifines and brings the 'survival horror' genre back in a big way.

You begin by crash landing on what appears to be an island covered by a dense forest. You awaken to a few items around you such as food, beer, an axe and other bits of what some would think of as junk. The thing of it is, from the moment of the planes impact, you are being watched and in some cases hunted. After grabbing all you can carry your best bet is to get as far away from the wreck as possible. Corpses of your former fellow passangers litter the land around you and while you may want to stop and admire the scenery (meaning the beautifully rendered foliage and lighting effects) however you MUST run.

Chasing you are a band of CANNIBALS. They are great in numbers but are merely studying you at first. You'll see them peering at you from the hill, or from behind a tree. Sometimes one, two, three or even more. Count your blessings and praise the sun for when the night falls, they will be braver.

Quickly you make a small fire, then a small shelter out of the trees you have cut down with your axe along with sticks and rocks you find all around the ground. All the while, you're being watched. Then it starts storming. Your fire needs to stay tended to otherwise it will go out and you will surely freeze.

Then the sun starts going down and the forest darkens. You hear screams in the distance and footsteps. There are 'warnings' made with the body parts of the airline's unfortunate passangers appearing all over your campsite that you were sure were not there 15 minutes ago.

Again, screaming. But this time, its getting closer. Suddenly, you see a light in the distance!! Could it be a rescue?

As the light gets closer you see shapes of scantidly clad beings walking twords you. The light is emmited from a bleached human skull one of them is carrying as they search for your exact location. This time, they are here for blood.....

I could tell you more, but where is the fun in that? This game is at this moment PRE-ALPHA. There are bugs, glitches and a host of other game breakers. But it never ceases to be fun and exciting. The price in my opinion is worth everything you get in THE FOREST in its current state. It can only get better from here.

This is a game of survival, and fortune does not favor you in THE FOREST. You are the prey.

Good luck, and hide well.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pVC6xXLc_Ek
Above is my video impressions of the game

The forest is an early access that is full of promise. The game looks great for such an early stage, with realistic visuals, and a large open world. Though it's enjoyable even at this point of the development cycle, it still has some rough edges to smooth over.

The game's survival is really about exploring than any thing else at the moment. If you expect a fully complete and polished game, you might want to wait for future updates. But if you're willing to buy into potential, the Forest is full of that (and hungry hungry cannibals.

Pros:
- Great looking graphics
- Awesome wood chopping" effects
- Almost all foliage is intractable / destructible
- Large open world to discover
- Freaky mutated cannibals are freaky

Cons:
- Still feels incomplete
- Wood falling effect a bit wonky
- Not much Narrative in current version"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nUpated as of v0.03    Well the game is coming along, although a bit slow.  Overall, they have addressed a few issues that people ahve had, while adding more stuff.  Obviously they cant't address every issue because this is alpha and they should worry about critical issues, and just adding stuff without breaking anything too badly.   For now, they have made a peaceful mode, which is great for those wanting something a bit tamer.   They are slowly adding more things to build, visuals are tweaked, and new things are added in the game itself.  However, there are still some issues with it that are annoying as hell, but are not THAT important.  The only thing Im worried about, is the length between updates.  I wouldnt mind shorter waits for small updates, while waiting longer for larger ones.   But time will tell.   I still look forward to this, but it will take some time before things are anywhere near complete

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you are looking for a complete, brutal survival game, you sir, are looking in the wrong place. Dont get me wrong, this is not a horrible game that isn't worth your money. If you're a fan of early access games, and you don't mind waiting for the next update (which comes rather fast with this development team), this is worth the time and money spent. This is a game that is progressing, bit by bit, and will easily shape in to a great, semi-realistic survival experience. This game is totally worth playing, though i only recommend this to people who enjoy watching a game make progress.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Three goes I gave this game, and each and every time I was at least entertained.

On my first attempt, I was struck by ungodly lag. After witnessing a child being taken away, I awoke to find myself on a plane. I chowed down on everything I could find on the plane and set out to find a tree to conquer.
Twas then that I stumbled upon a tribe of happy locals, ready and willing to show about the island on a wonderful and exciting running tour, which ended in my falling over a cliff edge.
It was in that time that I noticed just how nice the graphics are.
The locals must have noted my fall, as they took me to an underground dwelling where they had tied up all of the other passengers on the plane, probably to keep them from getting sick from the water on the cave floor.
Soon after I died, as it was too dark to see where I was going. The light I thought was the exit was a friendly local who beat me back to safety.
I lasted 2 days.

Attempt number 2 went a little better. I found an axe and set out to take down a tree again, but the lords of clipping failed me and I fell over another cliff. See attempt one for details.

Attempt number 3;
I was wise to the locals by this point. After devouring the plane, taking the axe and heading towards the best looking water I could find, I landed upon a beach. There was a dead local who I put to rest by blowing him apart, a tent with a stick I used to stab things, and plenty of beer.
I found a tree to conquer, but the locals must have come back for their friend, as they were waiting for me. I immediately hit legs, hoping they had not noticed me. I was not being chased so I imagined I was fine.
I found a boat and thought it would be a great place to hide, as these friendly locals did not seem to have a swimming school set up anywhere.
Night fell and all was peaceful, but I was definitely wrong about the swimming lessons. The locals swam out to assist me off the boat, but I refused and ran as fast as possible after exiting the boat.
It began raining as I reached safety, and I was told that I needed to start a fire. I had all of the things I needed but leaves, so I promptly froze to death in a small, premade hut that I think belonged to a local.

All in all, hard but fun. I enjoyed the tense feeling right the way through and look forward to future editions of the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is lovely. The crafting system is deep and satisfying. The atmosphere is forboding, and when it choses, The Forest can be legit scary. The devs seem like good eggs - the game receives very regular updates, issues and bugs are quickly addressed, and improvements always exceed expectations. I could details some of the frustrations I have had, over my hours with The Forest, but the vast majority were already addressed by the developers in recent patches. In particular, the recent graphical overhaul is substantial and welcome improvement to presentation. Spearing fish is neat. Chopping down trees is weirdly satisfying. The mutants are hella f'd up.

There's really only one problem with The Forest, as I see it - the game is still in Early Access, and will be for the foreseeable future - so I have to avoid putting in too many hours, so that the final build feels somewhat fresh.

tl;dr - game is good, devs seem good, you should buy.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

WARNING: ALPHA REVIEW!!

Well, from what I've played of this game so far it shows a lot of promise for an early access title. It is by no means complete at this point, but what it has right now is quite good. The AI is functional and can be downright unnerving at times. I've encountered several situations where the enemies would just climb trees and watch me, rather than trying to fight me. After about an hour of playtime, you start to realize the kinks and bugs with the game and enemies no longer become a problem once you know how to deal with them. There isn't a whole lot to do yet, and in just a few hours you can pretty much accomplish everything there is and not have much left to do other than occaisonally collect food.

As of right now, this game is definitely worth buying so that you can influence it's growth and development and help shape it into a better game for everyone.

8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So here i was. Me ansd my lovely son Winifred were taking a trip to see my mother in Albequerque when all of the sudden the front of the plane comes disatached from the rest, thank the Gods no one else was on board. I was suffering from hunger as i got my fat self up off the ground to find that the only other person on the plane had a hatchet buried deep into her chest which i had no problem removing. I picked up more booze that could possibly fit into my designer jeans. As I began to journey about 5 feet into the woods i thought i heard footsteps and the screams of humans being dismantled in the distant. I soon found a beach where i could cook and rest for the night. While i had my nice little hut set up i began to see apperitions of humans in the distance but i thought nothing of it being in such a strange place, when suddenly i was attacked from behind by a group of canibalistic justin beiber fans. I assume they wanted to share my fish and didnt know how to speak my english language. I awoke in a dark cave where i quickly see my shadow cascading along the long floor,i didnt have a head but that didnt seem to affect me one bit. I found a hatchet and a flare gun by somehow picking up and throwing down again i had unlimited ammo for said falre gun. I eventually found my way out of the cave and began to adapt quickly to my surroundings. I built a nice log cabin with walls for protection and even a fire to keep me warm at night. One day as i was chopping down a tree, a log seemed to have glitched through time and space when it counteracts with where i was standing and shoots me HIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIGH into the air.DEAD

I didnt think anything of because it thought i could reload where i was at in my game when i found that the load bar was unclickable. So all that work, killing innocent justin beiber fans, chopping down trees and the mass extension of the rabit population led me to nothing.

I definatly recomend this game because the women are naked
16/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where to start, this games intro lets the player really feel the fear. The survival aspect is really demanding from being tired, hungry, hurt, cold and wet, and being able to construct shelters. The islands inhabitants just really blow your mind on the ai scripting they will stalk you hunt you and re-group when they are hurt. They are by no means lazy they will run climb and come from every which way. graphics the game is smooth and beautiful it is what i would expect from something similar to the cry engine games which power games like far cry and crysis. the detail is beautiful and impressive from the vegitation to the wildlife you can hunt.
There is the ability to co-op with your friends which i have not tried due to the fact there is no server search currently but co-op is done by using there ip and yours to create a lobyy(simple and elegant.).
There are a few problems at the moment with the game but remember this is an alpha build.  Water is very simply implimented with water layers meaning you can see to the bottom and the edges of water are usually grassy no river system implimented. Sometimes with tree platforms you can build the trees will disapear and leave you just a floating platform. The bow is a nice addition but i would like to see a bigger better bow eventually with more power and maybe an aimer.
I would highly recomend this game its only 14.95 with the xmas sale and its better then most xbox one titles i play to date.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game features some amazing gameplay! The singleplayer is good but could ofcourse improve. As the devs mention in the section Development roadmap" They will be making the game graphics better aswell as improving the "running" of the game. I like the game and can't stop playing.
There are some things that I think should be quite high on the dev priority list though. I am not a software developer but I think that the bugs in multiplayer should be fixed. First and formost the bug where you can play a game with your friend
date:
both of you save in your shelter by pushing the C key and the you exit the server. When you come back in only the host will have kept his/her things like axes and food. The other thing that isn't really a glitch but a feature that would increase the gamplay experience is the ability to destroy or tear apart your buildings after you've started building or finished the build. My friends and I have realized that not being able to demolish your built stuff can be gamebreaking and make the gameplay less fun. Last but not least i would like to ask the developers to make it possible to share items with your friends in multiplayer (cop-op mode). This would make the gameplay more immersive and make the game a lot better. I hope the developers will take notice of these things and add them into the game although that is just my wish and I do understand if the developers want to chose another path for the game.

To sum it up. I like the game and would recommend it to anyone who is looking to play a scary game alone or with your friends. There are a few bugs and some features missing (according to me) that i hope the developers will fix/add to the game.

I give this game a 8/10 because of the things listed above
Kind regards

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played many of hours of The Forest so its about time I did a review for the game. The Forest is a Alpha game at this current time I have been playing and following since Alpha 0.01. The games updates are always so fun to see, its almost like playing a new game every update I love that about it.
The game has a different style of building compared to most games making it innovative. the AI of the cannibals can be so funny and scary at times making for a good mix. Being a Alpha game it will have bugs but the Developers always fix as many as possible each and every update. Probably the best part about the game is the ability to just jump in and PLAY no inventory sorting or thing that slow down the gameplay like that.

This was the first real" PC game I played (I use to be only a console gamer) and I had no problem figuring out the controls and such was very easy to learn and play. Reminds me of my childhood playing in the woods building forts and exploring the unknown I will always hold this game close to my heart for these reasons.

10/10 For the Alpha have and would recommend"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay so I kinda suck at this game. But I absolutely love it. I couldn't care less if I only survive 5 days, I love being able to build a camp and lay it out the way I want to. The mutant cannibal people are very well done and I like the fact that they make screaming sounds so you have some kind of idea if they are around. I love the tension while you run around trying to find supplies. You could be hunting bunnies and BAM, dead. I haven't seen any in game yet but I cannot wait to come across the other creatures on the island/in the forest. The random crash sites make me want to play it over and over to see if I get a bit more help so I can survive a bit longer (which I usually don't).

It's quite hard to see the way out of the cave when you first 'die'. Part of it's because you probably aren't supposed to be able to see that well, and the other part is the rendering that makes you think you are going the right way until a wall renders right in front of you. But that's okay, I'm sure they will patch all that kind of stuff up later.

It's early days and I cannot wait until it gets updated because this is a seriously awesome game and definitely my favorite at the moment.  10/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Absolutely terrific if you're into early access survival games and an absolutely terrific place to start if you're not. (TL;DR at bottom)

While most would say the story mode sets it apart, it's GIGANTIC island environment, or the stunningly intelligent AI, I think what sets this game apart from others is the amount of options you have.

This is key for any survival game, yet most miss out on it. With Rust, for example, you can play solo but chances are you wont get anywhere past a 2x2 home before getting raided by a group or another solo player OR you could be in a massive group, build a massive base and be touched by practically no one except other massive groups.

The Forest, however, has a plethora of options to choose from: you can live on land and fight off waves of mutants, move from temporary shelter to temporary shelter and hide from the mutants, build a house boat and live on the water, or just go on a rampage and hunt down every last mutant you find(they don't infinitely respawn) to claim the island yours.

And the AI is simply the best I've ever seen(if I could buy this game once if it meant one other game gets AI as good or better than this, I would not stop buying this game) They are so unique they practically amplify your options: They don't know you exist when you start, giving you a chance to have different playing styles when encountering them.

They are programmed to calculate and strategize, so if one of them sees your house and runs away, just know that your security needs to be amped up.

The only things I complain about with the AI are that there are no projectile shooting mutants, which makes living on the water pretty damn OP if you don't have to return to the shore at all.

Another thing is that there are tribes of these mutants that do fight each other and I feel that hasn't been used enough. I hope this game does get to the point where you can befriend tribes and rival others in both single player and co-op modes.

TL;DR:

PROS:

-Super intelligent AI(even for early access)
-Options and freedom(which most early access games miss out on)
-Story mode(it's being worked on but still)

CONS

-Optimization(pretty much the plague of every early access game. You could  just run it on low memory mode but it looks horrible)
-The need/lack of tribe mechanisms(I cannot stress this enough, this would be an amazing feature if you could join tribes, rival them, etc)

Final rating 9.8/10 buy this game. If it's on sale DEFINITELY buy it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has HUGE potential to become something great.

While it is Alpha and has some serious issues and perhaps even experience-breaking problems, it is very polished, the graphics are amazing, and the gameplay is quite stellar. Perhaps even matching the level of DayZ.

But not the security of DayZ.

You see, you DO have weapons in The Forest. But these weapons are nothing but sticks and stones, which don't break your bones, but are a somewhat usable weapon. But you will never stand a chance against the mutants. You don't have conventional guns that headshot mutants and make you more secure. Nothing like that. Instead, you have to sneak around them to increase survivability to a big extent. Bringing it to the enemy will only cause you more problems than it is necessary.

Shelters and evverything are built by scavenging the world, which has lots of variety and interactivity. You can chop down nearly anything, from plants, to big trees, to mutants. It only adds to the fun factor.

If you get caught, the game's survival horror genre comes into play. You are kidnapped into a server of caves, which are the mutants' hold-out and home. Your only way out is running around with a horridly-low-on-fuel BIC lighter. If you manage to make it out, good job, you can return to your house and recuperate, but fatality is quite likely in a lot of cases, so good luck.

All-in-all, very nice game, but since it is Alpha, it has bugs, and it is not very recommendable unless you are prepared to face with them.

9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A very nice survival game with horror and extensive crafting/building. Even though it has been in alpha for quite some time, it receives frequent and transparent updates. The developers seem to interact and listen with the community quite well, which is fairly rare for an early access game.
Like all survival games, it has the potential to become tedious after a few hours. I suspect the developers are working to combat this by adding more objectives, like rescuing other survivors.
Overall I can recommend this game to anyone who likes the survival-horror genre, building/crafting games, or unique co-op experiences.
