reviewText:
Early Access Review

v0.16

This game is a fantastic early access game. It has come a ways from the very beginning, and the custom building has improved noticeably. The switch to Unity 5 also helps things run very smoothly. I only have a one main criticism
that sparks from the new update.

-Tree Rendering - While the textures now look fantastic for most items, trees seem to rendering more poorly than before. Whereas trees looked the same before, they still maintained a respectable detailed shape out to quite some distance. Now, the trees become blockier faster and the colors pop out instead of being occluded by the environment and atmosphere.

Not game busting, and the advantages far outweigh the few cons. I'd recommend this to anyone who appreciates a true survival-horror experience. Be warned, this game can get difficult.

Love this game so far, personally I find it much more fun and impressive than Rust.
The game is pretty glitchy at the moment though and has all the normal Early Acess Problems.
There's not much you can do after you build the highest teir stuff, and make a base, then you just kinda see how long you can go without falling out of your tree house, but as they add more stuff the game will be far better than Rust, which i regret buying.

Bads:

If you are okay with waiting for updates then I definitly reccomend this game.

The game is brilliant!

While the bugs are frequent and the game crashes often (in my case once per hour) it was still a blast to play. I rarely write reviews but this game sure as hell deserves one!

The map is simple to navigate and the UI is very intuitive (within seconds i knew what i was doing and how).
The game ennemies are very well balanced in a way where they will only be a threat while traveling in a group.

This game shows great promise and has already pleased me.
I'd write more but honestly, you guys should experience it. This game is indeed a gem.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A fairly good game, even in its current buggy state.

Had a great time in this game for a few hours, the survival aspect is pretty neat and creative.  He really went above and beyond in creating new ideas that made a lot more sence.

The horror part of this game is also well though out, the mutants are pretty freaky, and if you explore any of the caves or their villages, its pretty badass.

The only thing this game is majorly lacking right now is the ability to save, and the inability to transport more than 2 logs at a time (Making some sort of towing system would make things much better).

Only sad thing is within a couple of hours I had killed all of the mutants on the parts of the island you can go to, so I never had to worry about attacks, and I could explore the item without even worrying.  My character finally decided life on the island was not worth living, and after failing to commit suicide by poisonous berries, plummeted to his death from a cliff.

Currently, the only way to pause the game is by alt+tabbing.  Going to the menu, opening your inventory, and so forth, does not pause the game.

Hope to see some new content and bug fixes!  Your doing pretty awesome!  Would also love to see Multiplayer!  Now that would easily rival rust and dayz!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The forest its a really interesting first person horror survival with excellent graphics, ambient, theme and mostly environment, it feels so unique and wonderful the place itself, you eventually feel like you are inside of the island

1. You start off on a plane with your son, and you crash land on a suspicious island fulled with life and other creppy creatures. The first couple of hours you will be terrified tryng to hide from the cannibals and trying to find a safe spot to bulid camp.

2. Bulding. For an early access game it comes will alot of stuff to bulid with. You want to start buliding a little house and walls to keep yourself safe. Also you can bulid rain collectors to drink and set up traps to kill rabbits lizards.

Pros
-The way the open world is
-All the types of cannibals from normal looking to down right the creepiest most ugly thing i've seen.
-All the bulding and customizable options for your character and your house.
-You can buld traps to kill the cannibals and for a source of food.
-When you get captured by the cannibals and you have to escape their turf avoiding them being stealthy, it give you that tingling felling in your balls you know.
-Each time you start a new game everything can change, the plane doesn't crash in the same spot and the cannibals can attack you right off the start.

Cons
-The cannibals AI can sometimes be really bad to the point I stop playing for a while.
-Also when you make a house I don't know if it's my game but the door laggs and it won't open or I get stuck in it.

But those are the only cons I have with the game. So I give this game a 10/10 does a 10 mean it's great no there are bugs that will make you mad. Sould you buy this game? HELL YES buy the game now. It can only get better and better :]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Was forced to go to Quebec for a field trip from Alberta.
Our plane crashed.
I wandered around the wilderness looking for help.
I met the average American tourist (camo shirt, twenty pounds overweight).
We had nothing to do, and it's Quebec.
We got bored.
Decided to cut down trees.
We met some Canadiens protesting nude for Francophone rights.
They looked at us funny.
At night, they started speaking in a really disgusting version of French.
Soon, they turned violent.
We bult a treehouse to serve as the Anglophone minority government.
They attacked us every night.
Every day we cut down an average of thirty trees.
The Canadiens got the vote and Bill 101 was passed.
We took refuge in a cave.
While in the cave we stumbled across 220 000 First Nations (So that's where they were hiding).
We didn't have any alcohol or drugs.
They beat us to death.

10/10 Would Canadien Again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The forest...

I waited for this game to play for a while, because on release it was a little buggy and the game has come a very long way since then. So on that note, let's get this done quickly!

Graphics: The graphics are very very good, push it to the max and enjoy some very nice detailing and meshing with a great atmosphere. It also plays super smooth.

Audio: The audio is very well presented offering some real in depth feeling from the forest or the crazy people's.

Controls: Super easy to get ahold and master, seriously no complaint at all, pickup and go.

Game: You crash land on the nicest plane crash ever, seriously watch it and it feels and looks so relaxing just a little bumpy... There is a few crazy people who are dangerous and thankfully the game has coop so you can play with friends and save it, so you both can return another time which is cool.

Sadly you can build a fort super quick and survive, but the game does not have much things to actually build though it seems. My friend and I built a big fort in under an hour and ran out of things to do because we built it all... Can be done very fast with two, so we set off on the hunt for the locals to kill, they are crazy and some are hard to defeat.

DO NOT VENTURE IN CAVES ALONE, some advice because creates lurk and are hard as hell Devils.

There is other things to do, go hunting, exploring (then getting lost easy so set a base marker is best way) and doing a few other bits and bobs but otherwise building is limited to barely any.

I love survival games, so added the great details, coop and beautiful surrounds and nice feature then this game is a win.

Would I recommend? Yes in seconds.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I like this gameidea i really do, but i advice you to not buy it! Here is why:

I recently picked this game up again to see some awesome changes, last time i played it was a year ago or something. Guess what there are like 2 or 3 things new that are cool but nothing else. Its like the developers have a great time with the money but they dont use it for the game.

Some things that are annyoing af:
-Alot of Caves with nothing in it but big Monsters, which you can kill but you get nothing in return. (for example: i killed several monsters, like 2 big wobbly guys who tried to jump on me, i had to use like 20 molotovs to kill them, just to hit a dead end or find a cassette with stupid music instead of a storyline)

they could easy add usefull stuff which you could only find in caves so it encourages ppl to go down there. I got everything good just by fightig noob monsters or no monsters at all (flashlight, modern axe, diving stuff, dynamite)
Finding stuff like a katana is cool but there is no use for it, i cant upgrade it and my upgraded axe is better in every way.

-They added a ToDo list which dosent even work, so why put it in the game?

-Coop is nice but for me as a the host i get freeze lags every minute or so, its kinda annoying. Weapon mods, the cavemap and ToDo list gets erased for the other player every time, which is also very annyoing.

etc.

They should have made enough money to make it a great game but if they keep their speed it will be maybe a great game in 6-10 years and i dont think they will develop it that long.

Its an alpha and that currently shows quite prominently thus far. However, disregarding its current development status I was pleasantly surprised to see the game still holds its own.

Its fun, really fun for the first few minutes before you're taken by storm from the islands inhabitants. You're gathering firewood, collecting game to roast on an open fire and building a shelter for the night. Well sonny you aint spending the night in that tent if this is the first time you're playing.
While I was constructing my necessities I saw in the distant way a patrol of these cannibals I have never encountered, because of watching certain videos on youtube about this game I knew stealth was an option so I crouched down and watched them go by. My heart was racing, my hands were shaking and I was finding myself still crouching as I continued on my merry way. Before long I saw another cannibal, I had already encountered this one as I remembered the destinct construct on its back. I had come to realise this was the tribe leader, as soon as I faced it, he ran away and climbed a tree.

Not a few more seconds after that, a female of the tribe steadily approached me uncaring to the axe I was weilding. Mate her ♥♥♥♥ were proper nice, voluptuous and shapely and them nipples on her were perfectly placed. I slowly walked to her before she lunged back, thinking back I swear I saw her almost uncovered minge. While taking a second to recover from my sudden shock, she also recovered of her own and took long strides with her long, curvy legs. Jumping at me she prepared her hands for the grab. Time went by slowly as I felt her delicious, mangled mouth comming on to my arm. For a moment we were connected, but she was in me with her long, hard teeth. Then my bloodfilled meat was in her willing, hungry mouth.

After this painful exchange my character feld dizzy and went for a bloody nap like the ♥♥♥♥ he is.


But yeah the games pretty buggy, expect to fall through the ground or suddenly die for no good reason. 8/8 though.

Several bugs, but I've actually not come across any myself except for when the entire world became water and I was swimming in everything.
That aside, this is an Early Access game, and right next to the 'Buy' button is a message from the Devs saying to only buy the game if you want to support the Devs by providing feedback, yada yada. That means you should probably do that. Only buy this game if you understand that it's an Early Access, still being made, and that you are playing it to support the Devs. For all those people complaining on the forums and such about missing content and bugs, forget them. reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is so fun! I have my positives and negatives about the game and I'll talk about the positive first. I like the way the game looks and the way it plays out is great. What I mean by that is I really like the AI for the Natives. It really gives me the idea that they are other players. There are times when they confuse the hell out of me by traveling to my camp in a group of 7 and then suddenly they're ganging up on one of their followers. I like the effigy's and how they actually stop and stare at it before they continue and sometimes they'll even turn around and leave. Crafting is simple and easy and as well as base building. There isn't anything in the survival booklet that is just a upgrade from the one above it, the Camp Fire cooks food and is reusable and the Bon Fire is just a light that can be seen from a great distance. The animal AI is kind of confusing right now, when ever I get within 5 yards of a Rabbit it begins running back and forth. It runs VERY well it's optimized extrmely well and I don't even have a great PC and I still run really well. I could go on and on of the things that were done so well but I'll stop there. Now for the negatives.

Firstly, the Bow, it is very weak against Natives and I was so happy when hearing it was going to be introduced and now its worse than the club. I do like how 1 stick and 5 feathers get 4 arrows though. One time I had 8 sticks and I was trying to find feathers and it turned out I had 43 feathers the whole time :P. Also, I really want to see a actual firearm. I do really like the survival feel to this game but if it's done correctly to match the theme they could make it so that they can spawn a handgun or hunting rifle and make it make since on how it may have got there. I also don't like how they show that Cannibal take the child in the introduction sequence. It doesn't add to the story (not that there is one) and it makes people who were playing for the first time think that immediently they're gonna chase after the child, well at least thats what I thought.

I know this game is in early access and I do not expect my opinion to apeal to anyone else, but I'd really like for the developers to take thought into what I said. Thank you for reading if you actually read the whole thing. I would deffiently recommend this game to everyone. Personal Rating: 8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

+1 would so recommend this game!
The first time I ever played this I was worried on what it would be like. I have never seen a game based in a forest before. Nor did I know what was going to happen, my first day in *The Forest* went like this:

Clicked play:
I suddenly noticed quickly I was in a plane, looking out the window into the peaceful puffy clouds. Soon realising that something had happen to the plane and we were loosing altitude quickly. Having my kid asleep next to me he woke up SO quickly and in shock. Then the glitch came about and he broke his back in the plane some how, I was devasted and so upset that he broke his back. But not to worry the plane soon crashed down and knocked me unconscious. After a bit I woke up to look at this..Person with paint and leaves as pants on them, picking up which once was my alive son. (Doesn't matter now his back broke through a glitch so who cares about my son)

I then woke up, it was day time. I must of been asleep for ages. I found an axe,food,pills,circuit boards and a few other useless items to me at this time. I then went out into the wild. Looking around the environment and all I could see was tree's in every direction, I saw bushes,logs,grass and the wildlife. I explored a little in one direction I then came across a beach. I looked around and I saw people. 4 of them infact, I walked up to them not knowing what would of happend. I then realised they were after me, ready to attack me and probably eat me.

I ran for my life, into the ocean and back onto the shore line. I then came back, they didn't know where I was. I was ready to surprise attack them with my trusty axe. I ran up  behind one hoping if I hit it in the head I would of killed it. That had not worked. It failed miserably, I decided to stay and fight against these people? I attacked them over and over and they took a while to die. I was worried I was going to die, after slaying 2 I felt I had this fight.

I then realised I was very low on hunger and health. I was going to win. I then died. I was hoping they would be an easy kill not some tough ♥♥♥ thing that takes like 15 hits to kill.

But that was my adventure when I first played.
Enjoyable,exciting,adventrous,amazing.

I enjoyed the wildlife, the environment I was in and all together gives that suspense on what it going to happen next or during the night. I would recommend this game to anyone! <3

Thanks for reading Cubed<3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Finally, after getting my hands on The Forest I can say I see promise in this game. This game has alot of bugs! So be warned before you buy this game. While playing this game can be fun it can also be frustrating at times. I have a lot of good moments and WTF moments but the WTF moments which can be fixed with some updates and time. My first day trying to survive was fun, I got off my crashed plane and found a beach where I would make home. During the day I made a fire and hut. Once night hit I decided to sleep. Sleeping is very helpful as it fills your stamina and saves the game for you. Once I woke up I was scared ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when three tribes people were standing on the beach looking at me. Once I got up and pulled out my little hatchet I was ready to fight only to see them run off into the forest. Now I was scared and didnt know what to do. This was a very cool moment that almost no games offer these days. The next day I upgraded my base adding a wall and traps. When night hit I decided to stay up and see what would happen. As I was sitting there I looked into the forest and saw a light. The more I watched I could see that it was tribes people. They finally reached the beach and wanted to fight. So I went hatchets blazing....lol... my trap was useless as they didn't step on it but still cool I could make one. I fought them and the kicked my ♥♥♥. I feel like they need to balance the damage the tribes people take, as for I didn't kill a single one. When you go up against 3 or more tribes people your prolly gonna die. When I died I thought the game was over well it wasn't. I woke up in a cave covered in blood and could see anything. I pulled out me lighter and looked around and found meds, flaregun and a better hatchet. I had to find my way out of the cave. Once I did that I went back to my base. Luckly they added a base marker so you know where to go or I would have been screwed. On my way back I fell off a mountain and died. Some way to die after that adventure. Lesson learned about running through thick brush. Overall this game is fun I would pick it up for $15. Below Ill post some of the bugs I encountered. I give this game a 7/10!! I hope you enjoy my review of The Forest.

Review Done on 6/8/14

Bugs
1.Lost my inventory
2.Nobody spawned including (animals and tribes people)
3.When you make a new camp you cant sleep there ( 1 camp per save) ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!!!
4.Cant fill wood storage. It only allowed my to put 1 log in it
5.Framerate drops and game is unplayable
6.Walk though tents and trees

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game IS in ALPHA and i have taken note of that and everything i reference is in light of that fact.

Ok so i saw the price was £11 for me, after all the hyp, i thought, you know what, that's good! So i buy the game.
When i got to the menu, full of excitement i was a little diss-appointed at the lack of options and maybe the menu could have looked a little nicer, but hey, its alpha!

Anyway i jumped right in after disabling the motion blur, personal preference. (you do have to do this every time you die, nothing saves, but more on that in a minuet) ok the opening scene is just how you see in the trailer. I won't give anything away but it's how it is portraid in the trailer as a plane crash. The opening scene isn't very long and your soon in for your first taste of the experience...

Now i have jumped out of the plane realising i have been left to fend for myeslf with bare tutorials, just a few notifications telling me im hungry. The first thing that really caught my eye was the stunning scenery! The pure expansion of greenery foliage goes beyond description. I soon realised that you can harvest a good majority of that foliage too!

Me being completely logical thought that using the plane crash as shelter is a good idea, only... you can't get back in the plane, i can only assume this is so it can't be abused and it forces you out to fend for yourself and build your own shelter! Which i like. Now something tells me these things are attracted to the lufthansa plane landing in there back garden and soon begin to investigate.... very soon...

The HUD is simple and personally i like the inventory, which is simply (i). The layout of the inventory is nice, it is easy to use, the only thing i would say is you can craft items, which there is no clear tutorial for which i have seen. There is very little help on this game. After about 5 minuets or so, i encounter my first jump scare, they are VERY sneaky! i turned around and there was a half naked man in my face. I hit him with my axe a few times... and a few more.... and a few more.... and a few more... yes these people seem to have an immunity to anything with a sharp edge! Eventually you can knock them down and kill them.

An issue ive encountered is once they aggro you it is VERY hard to loose them as your stamina will drain fast and they are TOUGH. It's best to try not to get seem AT ALL in the first place. So you WILL die probably sooner rather than later and it is not over there. You get taken to their lair... only to find more shinies! YES there are LOTS of collectables especially in the conveniantly placed suitcases lying around the wreckage... and the whole island. There is only one way in and one way out of the cave!  It is known to be able to fall through the map in the cave, again its just alpha. Once you are out the next time you die WILL be your last! Don't die again.

My advice is open the guide it does give you using (b) and build those first few basic items. My furthest so far is 5 days and it was enjoyable, however there are some underlining issues that are BIG in my eyes, these are as follows:

- The save feature is broken (atleast for a very vast amount of people such as myself) I REALLY need to be able to save my progress, because if i die i HAVE to watch the cut scene again, do the cave AGAIN.

- The log stockpile doesn't seem to work where you store logs for later use. Not sure if it's just me on that one but i can't anyway.

- The tribal people are a little bit OP in the fact that they are tough and spot you vey easily. Make sure you always have food, that gives you stamina to run!

With that said, this game has a ridiculous amount of potential, im really enjoying it, at night sometimes i don't want to leave the safety of my camp, thats a GOOD thing, the atmosphere is awesome, very tense. I am REALLY looking forward to co-op, which they have put in the future features list!

I am a bit unsure as to whether to recmmend thhis game simply because of a few big issues as stated above. BUT i WILL recommend it simply because when they are fixed this will be incredible. My advice is buy it whilst it's £11 or what ever your currency is and thank me later! Buy it now, enjoy it a small amount, enjoy it MORE when its public release!

Hope this helps...

Early Access Review

Do you enjoy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ yourself repeatedly?
Can't get enough of being paranoid and hiding in corners?
Do you like having a random stranger with a skirt made out of phone cables abudcting your child?

Then this game is for you.

Probably the best horror game I've played in a while, it scares so much, yet at the same time makes you reluctantly crawl back for more nightmares.

10/10 would ALT + F4 out of horror again

~The First Encounter~


Surviving a plane crash isn't so easy once i woke up what i saw was rows of seats and a few food trays,I decide to get out as soon as i came to I found an axe,The axe was hacked into a persons chest,I decide to grab it and start getting some wood and some food to try to survive,I decide to head north and i found a perfect area a little beach area,I look around and i see a  silhouette staring right at me,The silhouette starts to run at me so i run,I saw a boat in the ocean so i swimmed as fast as i could to the boat,i felt safe for a bit and saw a few other silhouettes they ran,huh they didn't see me"
recommended: So i decide to get off the boat to get some food since i'm starving
hoursPlayed: To my surprise the thing that chased me was still alive and ran straight towards me and punched me clear to the sky

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First impressions after 2 hours of gameplay:
I've purchased this game because after reading some of the reviews and discussions threads then I said ♥♥♥♥ it lets get this game, and I didn't regret it so far, the game looks gorgeous, the lighting effects and the textures are quite nice, the animations needs alot of improvements though, the gameplay seems okay, +1 for the inventory and the crafting catalogue, those were really good and unique, the canibals/mutants or whatever they are needs alot of improvement, and what's their point? are the curious? hungry? do they want to make contact? I hope their AI gets implemented with alot more of details, it would be nice also to have other variety of animals rather then just rabits and birds, as well as weapons, not actual weapons, just bows or something similar.
Coop would be perfect as well.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Finally, after getting my hands on The Forest I can say I see promise in this game. This game has alot of bugs! So be warned before you buy this game. While playing this game can be fun it can also be frustrating at times. I have a lot of good moments and WTF moments but the WTF moments which can be fixed with some updates and time. My first day trying to survive was fun, I got off my crashed plane and found a beach where I would make home. During the day I made a fire and hut. Once night hit I decided to sleep. Sleeping is very helpful as it fills your stamina and saves the game for you. Once I woke up I was scared ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when three tribes people were standing on the beach looking at me. Once I got up and pulled out my little hatchet I was ready to fight only to see them run off into the forest. Now I was scared and didnt know what to do. This was a very cool moment that almost no games offer these days. The next day I upgraded my base adding a wall and traps. When night hit I decided to stay up and see what would happen. As I was sitting there I looked into the forest and saw a light. The more I watched I could see that it was tribes people. They finally reached the beach and wanted to fight. So I went hatchets blazing....lol... my trap was useless as they didn't step on it but still cool I could make one. I fought them and the kicked my ♥♥♥. I feel like they need to balance the damage the tribes people take, as for I didn't kill a single one. When you go up against 3 or more tribes people your prolly gonna die. When I died I thought the game was over well it wasn't. I woke up in a cave covered in blood and could see anything. I pulled out me lighter and looked around and found meds, flaregun and a better hatchet. I had to find my way out of the cave. Once I did that I went back to my base. Luckly they added a base marker so you know where to go or I would have been screwed. On my way back I fell off a mountain and died. Some way to die after that adventure. Lesson learned about running through thick brush. Overall this game is fun I would pick it up for $15. Below Ill post some of the bugs I encountered. I give this game a 7/10!! I hope you enjoy my review of The Forest.

Review Done on 6/8/14

Bugs
1.Lost my inventory
2.Nobody spawned including (animals and tribes people)
3.When you make a new camp you cant sleep there ( 1 camp per save) ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!!!
4.Cant fill wood storage. It only allowed my to put 1 log in it
5.Framerate drops and game is unplayable
6.Walk though tents and trees

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very, very early access. Very buggy. Very unfinished and unpolished. Screams early alpha.

But god, what's there is AMAZINGLY FUN. The atmosphere of mystery and horror they've built up makes me feel like i'm playing my own version of Lost. Though every element present may be rather 1 note, they have the skeleton of what might be a truly amazing game.

Keep it up, and keep your eye on this.
